page.title: 09Inside Penkill Castle
page.content: Although the castle is fairly small, it has many rooms.Inside is a Banqueting Hall,Kitchen,Pantry,many bedrooms and a spiral staircase.The East Wing contains the Banqueting Hall which is fairly large and the kitchen. The Pantry is facing north because in those days there were no fridges and the North wind kept the food fresh. Many of the rooms have beautiful paintings, many by the Pre_ Raphelites who used the castle as a retreat at the end of the century. There is a spiral staircase in the tower with a long painting,"The king's Quair", depicting James VI. the "Curse of Penkill" room is so called because there is a picture on one wall with a curse above which reads"Move Not This Picture,Let It Be; For Love Of Those In Effigy"
